org.timepedia.chronoscope.client.data
Interface MipMapStrategy

All Known Implementing Classes:
BinaryMipMapStrategy
public interface MipMapStrategy

Strategy for converting an ordered set of data points into multiple coarser resolutions (i.e. "mip-mapping") for the primary purpose of speeding up visual rendering.

Author:
Chad Takahashi

Method Summary
 void appendXY(double x, double y, MipMapChain mipMapChain)

Method Detail

mipmap

MipMapChain mipmap(double[] domain,
                   double[] range)
Calculates the specified domain and range at decreasing levels of resolution.

Parameters:
domain - - the domain to be mipmapped
range - - the range to be mipmapped

mipmap

MipMapChain mipmap(double[] domain,
                   java.util.List<double[]> range)
Calculates the specified domain and n-tuple range at decreasing levels of resolution.

Parameters:
domain - - the domain to be mipmapped.
range - - the n-tuple range to be mipmapped; range.get(i) returns an array representing the i-th dimension of the range tuple values.

appendXY

              double y,
              MipMapChain mipMapChain)

setRangeValue

void setRangeValue(int pointIndex,
                   double y,
                   Array2D mipmappedRange)
Updates the Y-value of an existing datapoint within a dataset (optional operation).

Parameters:
pointIndex - - the 0-based index of the datapoint.
y - - the range value to be updated.
